clinical_study.brief_title: Status Asthmaticus on the Intensive Care Prospective - STATIC PRO
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors for Intensive Care Admission of Children With Severe Acute Wheeze or Asthma (SAA)

collaborator.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will prospectively assess the impact and relevance of several risk factors for children with severe acute asthma (SAA) or acute wheeze that have been identified in retrospective studies. Secondary we will assess short-term medical and psychosocial functioning in patient (and parents) admitted to a PICU for SAA/acute wheeze versus a control group admitted to a MC for SAA/acute wheeze.

primary_outcome.measure: Undertreatment in children admitted to a PICU with a diagnosis of SAA/acute wheeze
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within the time of admission on the PICU/MC, preferably within 48 hours and during follow up after 3-6 months
primary_outcome.description: Undertreatment is defined as: Patient is not using inhaled corticosteroids (ICS), or Patient is using ICS < 7 days (counting from moment of admission to emergency department) according to treatment plan, or Patient is not using ICS according tot treatment plan.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the time of admission on the PICU/MC, preferably within 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Pollution/airborne particulate matter (PM10), sensitization/allergen exposure, cigarette smoke exposure (measured by cotinine in urine), presence and type of virus in upper airway tract

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the time of admission on the PICU/MC

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of previous asthma-related hospital admissions and/or PICU admissions.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the time of admission on the PICU/MC and during follow up after 3-6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of disease, defined using the GINA criteria for stepwise management of asthma.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the time of admission on the PICU/MC, preferably within 48 hours and during follow up after 3-6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Distribution of ADRB2-receptor polymorphisms compared to non-SAA population.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, preferably within the time of admission on the PICU/MC

arm_group.description: Children aged 2-18 years admitted to a Paediatric Intensive Care Unit in the Netherlands, with a diagnosis of acute wheeze or SAA.
Children aged 2-18 years admitted to a Medium Care in the Netherlands, with a diagnosis of acute wheeze or SAA.

study_pop.textblock: Children aged 2-18 years admitted to a Medium Care or Paediatric Intensive Care Unit in the Netherlands, with a diagnosis of acute wheeze or SAA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 2 and 18 years of age
- Admission to a PICU for SAA or acute wheeze or admission to a MC for SAA or acute wheeze
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is outside of specified age range
- Down's Syndrome
- Congenital/acquired heart defect that interferes with normal SAA treatment
- Congenital/acquired airway defect (tracheomalacia/bronchomalacia)
- Primary/secondary immunodeficiency
- Pre-existing chronic pulmonary condition, known to mimic asthma: Cystic Fibrosis, Bronchopulmonary dysplasia, Bronchiolitis obliterans
- If both parents are not able to speak the Dutch language
